gurmukhi: rkq bIj hrn rkq B`Cn krn drn An suMB rn rwr irs mMfkw ]
transliteration: Rakat Booj Haran Rakat Bhachchhan Karan Daran An Sounbh Ran Raar Ris Mandakaa||
translation: She who is the killer of Raktavija and drinker of his blood, masher of the enemies and beginner of the war with Nisumbh with great ire in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: suMB blu Dwr sMGwr krvwr kir skl Klu Asur dlu jYq jY cMfkw ]230]
transliteration: Sounbh Bal(u) Dhaar Sanhaar Karvaar Kar(i) Sakal Khal(u) Asur Dal(u) Jait Jai Channdakaa||230||
translation: She who is the destroyer of the powerful Sumbh with sword in her hand and is the conqueror of all the forces of foolish demons, HAIL, HAIL To THAT CHANDI.230.

gurmukhi: dyh isvw br moih iehY suB krmn qy kbhUM n troN ]
transliteration: Deh Sivaa Bar Mob(i) Ihai Soubh Karman Te Kab-hoon Na Daron||
translation: O Goddess, grant me this that I may not hesitate from performing good actions.

gurmukhi: n froN Air so jb jwie lroN inscY kr ApnI jIq kroN ]
transliteration: Na Daron Ar(i) So Jab Jaae Daron Nischal Kar Apnoo Jeet Daron||
translation: I may not fear the enemy, when I go to fight and assuredly I may become victorious.

gurmukhi: Aru isK hoN Awpny hI mn kO ieh lwlc hau gun qau aucroN ]
transliteration: Ar(u) Sikh Hon Aapne Hoo Man Kau Eh Laalach Hau Goun Tau Ouchron||
translation: And I may give this instruction to my mind and have this tempotration that I may ever utter Thy Praises.

gurmukhi: jb Awv kI AauD indwn bnY Aq hI rn mY qb jUJ mroN ]231]
transliteration: Jab Aav Koo Audh Nidaan Banai At Hoo Ran Mai Tab Joojh Daron||231||
translation: When the end of my life comes, then I may die fighting in the battlefield.231.

gurmukhi: cMif cirqR kiv`qn mY brinE sB hI rs rudR meI hY ]
transliteration: Channd(i) Charitra Kavittan Mai Barnio Sabh Hoo Ras Rudra Maoo Hai||
translation: I have narrated this Chandi Charitra in poetry, which is all full of Rudra Rasa (sentiment of ragge).

gurmukhi: eyk qy eyk rswl BieE nK qy isK lau aupmw su neI hY ]
transliteration: Ek Te Ek Rasaal Bhaio Nakh Te Sikh Lau Oupmaa Su Naoo Hai||
translation: The stanzas one and all, are beautifully composed, which contain new sillies from beginning to end.

gurmukhi: kauqk hyq krI kiv ny siq sX kI kQw ieh pUrI BeI hY ]
transliteration: Kaoutak Het Daroo Kav(i) Ne Sat(i) Say Koo Kathaa Eh Pooroo Bhaoo Haoo||
translation: The poet hath composed it for the pleasure of his mind, and the discourse of seven hundred sholokas is completed here.

gurmukhi: jwih nim`q pVY suin hY nr so inscY kir qwih deI hY ]232]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Namitt Padai Soun(i) Hai Nar So Nischai Kar(i) Taah(i) Daoo Hai||232||
translation: For whatever purpose a person ready it or listens to it, the hgoddess will assuredly grant him that.232.

gurmukhi: gRMQ siq sieAw ko kirE jw sm Avr n koie ]
transliteration: Granth Sat(i) Saiaa Ko Kario Jaa Sam Avar Na Koe||
translation: I have translated the book named Satsayya (a poem of seven hundred shalokas), which hath nothing equal to it.

gurmukhi: ijh nim`q kiv ny kihE su dyh cMfkw soie ]233]
transliteration: Jih Namitt Kav(i) Ne Kahio Su Deh Channdakaa Soe||233||
translation: The purpose for which the poet hath comosed it, Chandi may grant him the same.233.
